timeline.author: prb112
prb112

timeline.bodyText:
this variable is hard to read.
useFhirServerTrustStore and update the FHIRConfiguration
timeline.author: prb112

timeline.bodyText: consistent with my other comment, it's hard to read
timeline.author: prb112
prb112

replies.bodyText:
this is configurable through job parameter, if without setting in job parameter, then the default value false is used at present.
I don't think we need to add it to the job parameter of the job operation, I think we can simply change the default value to true directly if need instead of adding a new config.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText:
hard to consume the constant name.   use/is - select one
isCosClientUseFhirServerTrustStore should be simplified
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: will change them all to useFhirServerTrustStore :)
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText: Why do you have to specify the tenantName/DatastoreId?
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: this is used for my local tests to make sure the per tenant configures for bulkdata working correctly.  example, I used "default" + "default", "postgresql" + "default" etc in my tests.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.message:
issue #1242 updates per review comments

Signed-off-by: Albert Wang <xuwang@us.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: I'd prefer to make the default true
timeline.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: as mentioned above, we can not.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText: I'd prefer to make the default true
timeline.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: as mentioned above, this will break S3 and IBM COS services which use public CAs instead of self signed certs.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: this would be a good limitation for us to document if we ever advertise our support for Minio
timeline.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: I'm still not sure how I feel about expanding our use of test.properties.  That properties file was originally just the client properties (used to instantiate FHIRClient).  I guess its OK though.
timeline.author: lmsurpre
